recipe.name: Cheesy Jalapeno Bacon Stuffed Baguette with Garlic Butter
recipe.description: A new idea for party food! This is great for making ahead. Just assemble then pop it in the freezer until you need it, then all you have to do is bake them when you are ready to serve! So many options for fillings....I've provided a few more ideas in the notes.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz / 250g   bacon, diced (I used lean bacon)
8 oz / 250g   Philadelphia cream cheese, softened (full or low fat)
1/4 cup packed jalapeños, finely chopped (if using fresh, deseed it. Or use canned, drained)
1 cup finely chopped scallions/shallots, green and white part (packed)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a pan over high heat. Add bacon and cook until lightly browned. Remove onto a plate lined with a paper towel to drain excess fat. Set aside to cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a pan over high heat. Add bacon and cook until lightly browned. Remove onto a plate lined with a paper towel to drain excess fat. Set aside to cool.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the ends off the baguette and cut the baguette in half (or quarters - makes it easier to stuff).
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the ends off the baguette and cut the baguette in half (or quarters - makes it easier to stuff).

recipeInstructions.text: Use a long knife (preferably bread knife) to cut the bread out, leaving about a 1/2" / 1.5cm wall of bread and crust. (Note 2)
recipeInstructions.name: Use a long knife (preferably bread knife) to cut the bread out, leaving about a 1/2" / 1.5cm wall of bread and crust. (Note 2)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the bacon, cream cheese, cheddar and mozzarella cheese, jalapeños, scallions/shallots and pepper in a bowl and mix until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the bacon, cream cheese, cheddar and mozzarella cheese, jalapeños, scallions/shallots and pepper in a bowl and mix until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a knife or piping bag to stuff the mixture inside the baguettes.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a knife or piping bag to stuff the mixture inside the baguettes.

recipeInstructions.text: Garlic Butter: melt butter with the garlic and salt in the microwave or on the stove.
recipeInstructions.name: Garlic Butter: melt butter with the garlic and salt in the microwave or on the stove.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush the baguette with garlic butter (or you can do this after you slice it).
recipeInstructions.name: Brush the baguette with garlic butter (or you can do this after you slice it).

recipeInstructions.text: Keep the slices pressed up against each other, and transfer to a large piece of foil.
recipeInstructions.name: Keep the slices pressed up against each other, and transfer to a large piece of foil.

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap the baguette, then bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the bread is crusty and the cheese inside is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap the baguette, then bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the bread is crusty and the cheese inside is melted.

review.reviewBody: I did this and swapped with sausage meat. Absolutely delicious and a massive hit with everyone.  10/10

Oh. My. Hat.

Best bread ever! Made it for a Christmas party and everyone LOVED it. 

Thanks so much for this
